intro: Spermacoce rubra, commonly known as red rattlebox, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias, and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers. The plant produces distinctive, inflated seed pods that turn red when mature, containing numerous tiny seeds. Spermacoce rubra typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and thickets. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
